io.orchestrate.client

Class KvResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.orchestrate.client.KvResource

  • public class KvResource
extends java.lang.Object
    The resource for the KV features in the Orchestrate API.

    • Field Summary

      The Orchestrate client to make requests with.

      The object mapper used to deserialize JSON responses.

    • Method Detail

      • bulkPut

        public BulkOperation bulkPut(@NonNull
                             java.lang.Object value)
        Store an object by key to the Orchestrate service as part of a bulk operation.

        Usage:

         
 client.bulk()
   .add(client.kv("someCollection", "key1").bulkPut(obj))
   .add(client.kv("someCollection", "key2").bulkPut(obj))
   .add(...)
   .done();
        Parameters:
        value - The object to store.
        Returns:
        The bulk operation.
        See Also:
        put(Object), Client.bulk()

      • delete

        public OrchestrateRequest<java.lang.Boolean> delete()
        delete(boolean).
        Returns:
        The prepared delete request.

      • delete

        public OrchestrateRequest<java.lang.Boolean> delete(boolean purge)
        Purge a KV object from a collection in the Orchestrate.io service. This will permanently remove the record from the service, and cannot be undone.

        Usage:

         
 boolean result =
         client.kv("someCollection", "someKey")
               .delete(Boolean.TRUE)
               .get();
        Parameters:
        purge - If true, permanently delete the object AND its "ref" history from Orchestrate.
        Returns:
        The prepared delete request.

      • get

        public <T> OrchestrateRequest<KvObject<T>> get(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        get(Class).
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type to deserialize the result to.
        Parameters:
        clazz - Type information for marshalling objects at runtime.
        Returns:
        This KV resource.

      • get

        public <T> OrchestrateRequest<KvObject<T>> get(@NonNull
                                               java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                                               @Nullable
                                               java.lang.String ref)
        Fetch an object by key from the Orchestrate service.

        Usage:

         
 KvObject<DomainObject> object =
         client.kv("someCollection", "someKey")
               .get(DomainObject.class)
               .get();
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type to deserialize the result to.
        Parameters:
        clazz - Type information for marshalling objects at runtime.
        ref - The version of the object to get.
        Returns:
        This KV resource.

      • ifMatch

        public KvResource ifMatch(@NonNull
                          java.lang.String objectRef)
        The last known version of the stored object to match for the request to succeed.
        Parameters:
        objectRef - The last known version of the stored object.
        Returns:
        This KV resource.

      • withFields

        public KvResource withFields(java.lang.String withFields)
        Apply field-filtering to the result JSON, using this list of fully-qualified field names as a whitelist of fields to include.

        KvObject<DomainObject> object = client.kv("someCollection", "someKey") .withFields("value.name.first,value.name.last") .get(DomainObject.class) .get();

        Parameters:
        withFields - The comma separated list of fully-qualified field names to select.
        Returns:
        This request.

      • withoutFields

        public KvResource withoutFields(java.lang.String withoutFields)
        Apply field-filtering to the result JSON, using this list of fully-qualified field names as a blacklist of fields to exclude.

        KvObject<DomainObject> object = client.kv("someCollection", "someKey") .withoutFields("value.name.first,value.name.last") .get(DomainObject.class) .get();

        Parameters:
        withoutFields - The comma separated list of fully-qualified field names to reject.
        Returns:
        This request.

      • put

        public OrchestrateRequest<KvMetadata> put(@NonNull
                                          java.lang.Object value)
        Store an object by key to the Orchestrate service.

        Usage:

         
 DomainObject obj = new DomainObject();
 KvMetadata kvMetadata =
         client.kv("someCollection", "someKey")
               .put(obj)
               .get();
        Parameters:
        value - The object to store.
        Returns:
        The prepared put request.
